definition[0]: to move from a higher level to a lower one
example[1]: I heard his footsteps descending the stairs.
example[2]: The path continues for some way before descending to Garsdale Head.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say go down or come down rather than descend:
example[3]: They went down into the lobby.
example[4]: I heard his footsteps coming down the stairs.
definition[1]: if darkness, silence, a feeling etc descends, it becomes dark etc or you start to feel something, especially suddenly
example[5]: Total silence descended on the room.
example[6]: An air of gloom descended over the party headquarters.
